issue.title: Horizontal window is a fixed size
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
It doesn't seem that you can change the width of the window in horizontal mode, at least not when overriding a preset. I've tried an explicit `width` parameter as well as various `table_columns` parameters.

**List relevant hardware/software information**
- Linux Distribution: SteamOS 3.5 in Preview
- MangoHud version: (Whatever's in 3.5. Sorry, I'm not sure how to tell.)
- GPU: Steam Deck's Aerith APU

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
`$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/MangoHud/presets.conf`:
```
[preset 1]
horizontal
hud_no_margin
width=200
table_columns=3
legacy_layout=0
fps
frametime=0
frame_timing=1
```

**Expected behavior**
The width of the background can be changed as specified.

**Screenshots**
Screenshots taken on the Deck don't include the FPS overlay, but I was able to record video including it.
![vlcsnap-2023-09-21-11h26m54s579-crop](https://github.com/flightlessmango/MangoHud/assets/4130673/3f67db80-e714-4d54-99fd-26a84632ecbe)

**Additional context**
The idea here is that I'm trying to change the Deck's first preset to show both FPS and frametime, and nothing else. The background stretches far out past where I need it. I can work around this issue with `background_alpha=0.0`, but it becomes hard to see in bright scenes.

issue.title: Horizontal window is a fixed size
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
It doesn't seem that you can change the width of the window in horizontal mode, at least not when overriding a preset. I've tried an explicit `width` parameter as well as various `table_columns` parameters.

**List relevant hardware/software information**
- Linux Distribution: SteamOS 3.5 in Preview
- MangoHud version: (Whatever's in 3.5. Sorry, I'm not sure how to tell.)
- GPU: Steam Deck's Aerith APU

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
`$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/MangoHud/presets.conf`:
```
[preset 1]
horizontal
hud_no_margin
width=200
table_columns=3
legacy_layout=0
fps
frametime=0
frame_timing=1
```

**Expected behavior**
The width of the background can be changed as specified.

**Screenshots**
Screenshots taken on the Deck don't include the FPS overlay, but I was able to record video including it.
![vlcsnap-2023-09-21-11h26m54s579-crop](https://github.com/flightlessmango/MangoHud/assets/4130673/3f67db80-e714-4d54-99fd-26a84632ecbe)

**Additional context**
The idea here is that I'm trying to change the Deck's first preset to show both FPS and frametime, and nothing else. The background stretches far out past where I need it. I can work around this issue with `background_alpha=0.0`, but it becomes hard to see in bright scenes.

issue.title: Horizontal window is a fixed size
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
It doesn't seem that you can change the width of the window in horizontal mode, at least not when overriding a preset. I've tried an explicit `width` parameter as well as various `table_columns` parameters.

**List relevant hardware/software information**
- Linux Distribution: SteamOS 3.5 in Preview
- MangoHud version: (Whatever's in 3.5. Sorry, I'm not sure how to tell.)
- GPU: Steam Deck's Aerith APU

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
`$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/MangoHud/presets.conf`:
```
[preset 1]
horizontal
hud_no_margin
width=200
table_columns=3
legacy_layout=0
fps
frametime=0
frame_timing=1
```

**Expected behavior**
The width of the background can be changed as specified.

**Screenshots**
Screenshots taken on the Deck don't include the FPS overlay, but I was able to record video including it.
![vlcsnap-2023-09-21-11h26m54s579-crop](https://github.com/flightlessmango/MangoHud/assets/4130673/3f67db80-e714-4d54-99fd-26a84632ecbe)

**Additional context**
The idea here is that I'm trying to change the Deck's first preset to show both FPS and frametime, and nothing else. The background stretches far out past where I need it. I can work around this issue with `background_alpha=0.0`, but it becomes hard to see in bright scenes.

comment.body: This is now fixed in SteamOS 3.5.1. Thanks for your time, all!

issue.title: Getting segmentation fault when using with gamescope
issue.body:
I'm using latest from main on arch.

I get segmentation fault when used with gamescope:
```
% AMD_VULKAN_ICD=RADV gamescope glxgears
No CAP_SYS_NICE, falling back to regular-priority compute and threads.
Performance will be affected.
[2022-08-17 01:15:12.937] [MANGOHUD] [info] [config.cpp:118] skipping config: '/usr/bin/MangoHud.conf' [ not found ]
[2022-08-17 01:15:12.937] [MANGOHUD] [info] [config.cpp:118] skipping config: '/home/markus/.config/MangoHud/gamescope.conf' [ not found ]
[2022-08-17 01:15:12.937] [MANGOHUD] [info] [config.cpp:123] parsing config: '/home/markus/.config/MangoHud/MangoHud.conf'
vulkan: selecting physical device 'AMD RADV VEGA10': queue family 1
vulkan: physical device supports DRM format modifiers
[2022-08-17 01:15:12.998] [MANGOHUD] [error] [file_utils.cpp:43] Error opening directory '/sys/class/drm/card0-HDMI-A-1/device/hwmon/': No such file or directory
[2022-08-17 01:15:12.998] [MANGOHUD] [error] [file_utils.cpp:43] Error opening directory '/sys/class/drm/card0-DVI-D-1/device/hwmon/': No such file or directory
[2022-08-17 01:15:12.998] [MANGOHUD] [error] [file_utils.cpp:43] Error opening directory '/sys/class/drm/card0-DP-2/device/hwmon/': No such file or directory
[2022-08-17 01:15:12.998] [MANGOHUD] [error] [file_utils.cpp:43] Error opening directory '/sys/class/drm/card0-HDMI-A-2/device/hwmon/': No such file or directory
[2022-08-17 01:15:12.998] [MANGOHUD] [info] [overlay.cpp:768] Uploading is disabled (permit_upload = 0)
vulkan: supported DRM formats for sampling usage:
vulkan:   0x34325241
vulkan:   0x34325258
vulkan:   0x3231564E
[1]    5591 segmentation fault (core dumped)  AMD_VULKAN_ICD=RADV gamescope glxgears
```

 gdb trace:
```
(gdb) bt full
#0  0x00007fffe8dd163a in  () at /usr/lib/libMangoHud.so
#1  0x000055555559bca2 in  ()
#2  0x0000555555587d75 in  ()
#3  0x00005555555604c9 in  ()
#4  0x00007ffff74952d0 in __libc_start_call_main (main=main@entry=0x55555555f190, argc=argc@entry=1, argv=argv@entry=0x7fffffffdbc8) at ../sysdeps/nptl/libc_start_call_main.h:58
        self = <optimized out>
        result = <optimized out>

                      unwind_buf = {cancel_jmp_buf = {{jmp_buf = {140737488346056, -2738145751233012003, 0, 140737488346072, 93824992966616, 140737354125312, 2738145752197947101, 2738127417259908829}, mask_was_saved = 0}}, priv = {pad = {0x0, 0x0, 0x7fffffffdbc8, 0x1}, data = {prev = 0x0, cleanup = 0x0, canceltype = -9272}}}
        not_first_call = <optimized out>
#5  0x00007ffff749538a in __libc_start_main_impl (main=0x55555555f190, argc=1, argv=0x7fffffffdbc8, init=<optimized out>, fini=<optimized out>, rtld_fini=<optimized out>, stack_end=0x7fffffffdbb8) at ../csu/libc-start.c:381
#6  0x0000555555563095 in  ()
```

comment.body:
> and still got the same error

You're not supposed to use mangohud with gamescope.
This is what mangoapp is for

issue.title: Failed to parse PCI device
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Mangohud crashes any game if used through proton? (only tested dota2 vulkan without issues)
glxgears and vkcube crash

Odd part is it still works in dota; but if i run gears it returns:
`[⚡] × mangohud glxgears
[2023-10-07 08:31:32.661] [MANGOHUD] [error] [overlay.cpp:768] Failed to parse PCI device ID: '0:0000:01'
[2023-10-07 08:31:32.661] [MANGOHUD] [error] [overlay.cpp:769] Specify it as 'domain:bus:slot.func'
[2023-10-07 08:31:32.664] [MANGOHUD] [error] [nvml.cpp:29] Getting device handle by PCI bus ID failed: Not Found
[2023-10-07 08:31:32.664] [MANGOHUD] [error] [nvml.cpp:30] Using index 0.
[2023-10-07 08:31:32.670] [MANGOHUD] [info] [gl_renderer.cpp:422] GL version: 4.6
Running synchronized to the vertical refresh.  The framerate should be
approximately the same as the monitor refresh rate.
X Error of failed request:  BadValue (integer parameter out of range for operation)
Major opcode of failed request:  157 (NV-CONTROL)
Minor opcode of failed request:  27 ()
Value in failed request:  0x17
Serial number of failed request:  14
Current serial number in output stream:  14
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::system_error'
what():  Resource deadlock avoided
fish: Job 1, 'mangohud glxgears' terminated by signal SIGABRT (Abort)`

**List relevant hardware/software information**
OS: Garuda Linux
MangoHud version: 0.7.0-1
Intel iGpu and Nvidia 3080 Laptop max-q 16gb

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Attempt to use mangohud in any game and it will crash

**Expected behavior**
Mangohud should parse and render.

**Additional context**
Doesn't matter what gpu it's set to. It still fails to parse.
`
0000:00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation TigerLake-H GT1 [UHD Graphics] (rev 01)
0000:01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation GA104M [GeForce RTX 3080 Mobile / Max-Q 8GB/16GB] (rev a1)`
Nvida Driver Version: 535.113.01

`[⚡] × VK_LOADER_DEBUG=all mangohud vkcube
DRIVER | LAYER:       <Device>
DRIVER | LAYER:           Using "NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 Laptop GPU" with driver: "libGLX_nvidia.so.0"
[2023-10-07 08:45:00.600] [MANGOHUD] [error] [overlay.cpp:768] Failed to parse PCI device ID: '0:0000:01'
[2023-10-07 08:45:00.600] [MANGOHUD] [error] [overlay.cpp:769] Specify it as 'domain:bus:slot.func'
[2023-10-07 08:45:00.603] [MANGOHUD] [error] [nvml.cpp:29] Getting device handle by PCI bus ID failed: Not Found
[2023-10-07 08:45:00.603] [MANGOHUD] [error] [nvml.cpp:30] Using index 0.
X Error of failed request:  BadValue (integer parameter out of range for operation)
Major opcode of failed request:  157 (NV-CONTROL)
Minor opcode of failed request:  27 ()
Value in failed request:  0x17
Serial number of failed request:  14
Current serial number in output stream:  14
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'fish: Job 1, 'VK_LOADER_DEBUG=all mangohud vk…' terminated by signal SIGSEGV (Address boundary error)`

comment.body: I used downgrade to the last 6.x version and it solved this issue for me.

comment.body:
> that's a different error, it's a bug that's been fixed after 0.7. You would need to get a newer or older version

What version is that? I have the same "X Error of failed request: BadValue (integer parameter out of range for operation)..." problem. I'm using Bottles and Flatpak MangoHud and there hasn't been any updates since 0.7 was finally released for Flatpak too.

i do
echo $ENABLE_VKBASALT

issue.title: Counter Strike 2 crashes with mangohud after latest CS2 update
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
MangoHUD works within the menus, but trying to load into a game causes a crash

`/redacted/steamapps/common/Counter-Strike Global Offensive/game/cs2.sh: line 115: 20173 Segmentation fault      (core dumped) ${STEAM_RUNTIME_PREFIX} ${GAME_DEBUGGER} "${GAMEROOT}"/${GAMEEXE} "$@"`

**List relevant hardware/software information**
OpenSUSE Tumbleweed 20230927
Linux 6.5.4
Mesa 23.1.8
R5 5600/RX 5700XT
MangoHUD 0.6.9 and 0.7.0

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Practice -> Casual -> Nuke -> Play

comment.body: This should be fixed in latest master

commits.message: mangohud bin: add an array of items to disable LD_PRELOAD, added cs2.sh to DISABLE_LD_PRELOAD
